scenarioDescription:
The HD 76700 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 76700 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.37 times its radius. It is located 198.57 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 11 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 76700 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 76700 system


HD 76700 b

HD 76700 b was discovered by the Anglo-Australian Telescope observatory, in 2003-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 76700 b is 66.780 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 76700 b is 9.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 76700 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 76700, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Anglo-Australian Telescope.
name: HD 76700 - System With 1 Exoplanet
